OOC: Whoa, there! I was just going with my own storylines, I wasn't trying
to make everyone cease fire or anything like that. Technosis wasn't
important to anyone, I thought, but Chordate is such a powerful figure, that
it's easy to cause havoc by doing something like that. Understand now?
Deemos taking Technosis captive didn't insure a victory for the CHosen Ones,
he just wanted to leave there with Technosis, no problem. If the Alliance
left with Chordate, would there be a problem with that? If so, then we have
the hostage crisis all over again, except that unitron will probably fool
everyone into going to the Alliance base and stuff to kill them all. And if
there wouldn't be a problem. Well, Chordate will die. Tarantopulous isn't
about to give up something he believes in, so he keeps firing. CHordate
means nothing to him. You see?...

----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 10, 2001 8:20 PM
Subject: Re: Battle at the Cybertronian Fire


> Soulstice, chill. Look at yourself before blaiming others. When
> Deemos was at large, you had his group going around and attacking
> factions, and you did take your own bots hostage.
>
>
>
>
>
>

> > OOC: Ohhh, nice, who is this code you keep talking about? I hope
> you are not

> don't know.
> > What you say is not fitting at all, Chordate getting kidnapped? You
> seem to
> > me to be prejudice towards the Maximals. I am the mouthpiece for
> EVERYONE

> insure a
> > victory for the Alliance. Prove me wrong...
